content: Yes! This is a very good point! Feedbacks that go “it’s not that you are not ______ , but…” have a high probabilty of coming off as dismissive and inauthentic because instead of focusing on the issue at hand (what we really want to resolve), we dilute the focus of the conversation with mixed signals. A boss who wants to keep up with the image of being “nice” might want to come off as polite (foot in the door) before delivering the “bad stuff”; but a good leader would address the issue as-a-matter-of-factly (effectively) because it is not personal!
